sentences: Loretta Thompson-Glickman (May 23, 1945 - March 18, 2001) was the first African-American Mayor of Pasadena, California.
Glickman was a jazz singer and toured with the New Christy Minstrels before retiring from the entertainment industry in 1975 to start a family.
In 1977, she became the first black woman elected as a Pasadena city director.
Four years later, she became the city's first black vice mayor, before becoming mayor in 1982.
